node.Title: How we scaled and protected Eurovision 2023 voting with Pages and Turnstile
node.Description: More than 162 million fans tuned in to the 2023 Eurovision Song Contest, the first year that non-participating countries could also vote. Cloudflare helped scale and protect the voting application based.io, built by once.net using our rapid DNS infrastructure, CDN, Cloudflare Pages and Turnstile

node.Title: All the way up to 11: Serve Brotli from origin and Introducing Compression Rules
node.Description: Today, we're enhancing our support for Brotli compression, enabling end-to-end Brotli compression for web content. Compression plays a vital role in reducing bytes during transfers, ensuring quicker downloads and seamless browsing

node.Title: Making Cloudflare Pages the fastest way to serve your sites
node.Description: Pages is now the fastest way to serve your sites across Netlify, Vercel and many others and we’re so proud

node.Title: Speeding up APIs with Ricochet for API Gateway
node.Description: Today we’re announcing Ricochet for API Gateway, the easiest way for Cloudflare customers to achieve faster API responses through automatic, intelligent API response caching

node.Title: Introducing the Cloudflare Radar Internet Quality Page
node.Description: The new Internet Quality page on Cloudflare Radar provides both country and network (autonomous system) level insight into Internet connection performance (bandwidth) and quality (latency, jitter) over time based on benchmark test data as well as speed.cloudflare.com test results

node.Title: The Overflow #183: Dev Survey on AI: Hype or not?
node.Description:
The birth of Agile, taking notes in an interview, and CSS nesting

The post The Overflow #183: Dev Survey on AI: Hype or not? appeared first on Stack Overflow Blog.

node.Title: A step-by-step guide to transferring domains to Cloudflare
node.Description: Transferring your domains to a new registrar isn’t something you do every day, and getting any step of the process wrong could mean downtime and disruption. We’ve built a domain transfer checklist to help you quickly and safely transfer your domains to Cloudflare

node.Title: Throwing away the script on testing (Ep. 583)
node.Description:
Syed Hamid, founder and CEO of no-code test automation platform Sofy, joins Ben and Ryan to talk about scriptless automation, why his platform targets mobile app developers, and what he learned in nearly two decades at Microsoft. 

The post Throwing away the script on testing (Ep. 583) appeared first on Stack Overflow Blog.

node.Title: Intro To JavaScript Service Workers
Vault 1.14 brings ACME for PKI, AWS roles, and more improvements
node.Description: HashiCorp Vault 1.14 includes the Vault Secrets Operator GA, ACME PKI, and a new OpenLDAP secrets engine.

node.Title: Do You Know Where All Your Data Is?
node.Description:
Six ways a hybrid data platform modernizes financial services

The post Do You Know Where All Your Data Is? appeared first on Cloudera Blog.

node.Title: Speeding up your (WordPress) website is a few clicks away
node.Description: In this blog, we will explain where the opportunities exist to improve website performance, how to check if a specific site can improve performance, and provide a small JavaScript snippet which can be used with Cloudflare Workers to do this optimization for you

node.Title: Descale your network with Cloudflare’s enhanced Descaler Program
node.Description: At its core, the Descaler Program helps derisk change. It’s designed to be simple and straightforward, with resources to ensure a smooth transition and supporting technology to ensure the migration achieves your organization's goals

node.Title: Understanding end user-connectivity and performance with Digital Experience Monitoring, now available in beta
node.Description: DEX allows administrators to monitor their WARP Deployment and create predefined application tests. Features include live team & device analytics, server and traceroute tests, Synthetic Application Monitoring, and Fleet Status for real-time insights on WARP deployment

node.Title: Benchmarking dashboard performance
node.Description: The Cloudflare dashboard is a single page application that houses all of the UI for our wide portfolio of existing products, as well as the new features we're releasing every day.

node.Title: Network performance update: Speed Week 2023
node.Description: In this post we are going to share the most recent updates, and tell you about our tools and processes that we use to monitor and improve our network performance.

node.Title: How we think about Zero Trust Performance
node.Description: In this blog, we’re going to talk about why end-to-end performance is the most important thing to look at, why other methods like proxy latency and decrypted latency SLAs are insufficient for performance evaluations, and how you can measure your Zero Trust performance like we do

node.Title: Globally distributed AI and a Constellation update
node.Description: Today we’re announcing new Constellation features, explain why it’s the first globally distributed AI platform and why deploying your machine learning tasks in our global network is advantageous.

node.Title: Donning a MASQUE: building a new protocol into Cloudflare WARP
node.Description: Announcing support for MASQUE, a cutting-edge new protocol for the beta version of our consumer WARP iOS app

node.Title: Using the Elastic Agent to monitor Amazon ECS and AWS Fargate with Elastic Observability
Research with Snyk and Redhunt Labs: Scanning the top 1000 orgs on GitHub
node.Description: In a recent research project, Snyk and Redhunt Labs set out to learn more about the security posture of popular GitHub repositories. Read on to learn more.

node.Title: Sustainability is Elastic: 6 months of reflection
Transforming defence with Elastic AI and data capabilities
The generative AI societal shift
Crafting a better, faster code view
node.Description: The new GitHub Code View brings users many new features to improve the code reading and exploration experiences, and we overcame a number of unique technical hurdles in order to deliver those features without compromising performance.

node.Description:

node.Title: Cloudflare Snippets is now available in alpha
node.Description: Cloudflare Snippets are available in alpha. Snippets are a simple way of executing a small piece of Javascript on select HTTP requests, using the ruleset engine filtering logic

node.Title: Part 2: Rethinking cache purge with a new architecture
node.Description: In this post we’ll be talking about some of the architecture improvements we’ve made so far for Cache Purge and what we’re working on now

node.Title: Spotlight on Zero Trust: We're fastest and here's the proof
node.Description: Cloudflare is the fastest Secure Web Gateway in 42% of testing scenarios, the most of any provider. Cloudflare is 46% faster than Zscaler, 56% faster than Netskope, and 10% faster than Palo Alto for ZTNA, and 64% faster than Zscaler for RBI scenarios

node.Title: It's never been easier to migrate thanks to Cloudflare's new Migration Hub
node.Description: Today, we are thrilled to relaunch Turpentine, and introduce Cloudflare's new Migration Hub. The Migration Hub serves as a one-stop-shop for all migration needs, featuring brand-new migration guides that bring transparency and simplicity to the process
